about_the_game:
This first part features the Lamborghi SC63, which made its debut in both IMSA and the Le Mans 24h this year, running in the GTP and LMDh classes respectively  winning the hearts of fans with its stunning looks and beautiful roar.

The latest iteration of the now classic Lamborghini Huracán GT3 EVO2 likewise could not go amiss, bringing its distinct sharp angular lines to the GT3 Gen2 / GTD class.

The third model in this Dream Pack is the Lamborghini Huracán Super Trofeo EVO2, as ran in the namesake Lamborghini Super Trofeo series in America, Europe and Asia. Albeit very similar to the GT3 Huracán, the Super Trofeo delivers more power from its V10 engine (612hp vs 580hp by the GT3 EVO) but for less overall downforce from the bodywork running on narrower tires, making it for what is actually a quite different and very interesting driving experience.

Finally, for the fourth car in the pack you might follow the Lamborghini motto by expecting the unexpected - the 2014 Lamborghini Veneno Roadster, open top variant of the 2013 Veneno, with its mighty V12 delivering 740 HP through its AWD driveline.this real-life Batmobile also produces tons of downforce and is just the type of car one would dream of taking to the Nordschleife for a truly hair-raising experience. The Veneno Roadster joins the Hypercars class.
detailed_description:
This first part features the Lamborghi SC63, which made its debut in both IMSA and the Le Mans 24h this year, running in the GTP and LMDh classes respectively  winning the hearts of fans with its stunning looks and beautiful roar.

The latest iteration of the now classic Lamborghini Huracán GT3 EVO2 likewise could not go amiss, bringing its distinct sharp angular lines to the GT3 Gen2 / GTD class.

The third model in this Dream Pack is the Lamborghini Huracán Super Trofeo EVO2, as ran in the namesake Lamborghini Super Trofeo series in America, Europe and Asia. Albeit very similar to the GT3 Huracán, the Super Trofeo delivers more power from its V10 engine (612hp vs 580hp by the GT3 EVO) but for less overall downforce from the bodywork running on narrower tires, making it for what is actually a quite different and very interesting driving experience.

Finally, for the fourth car in the pack you might follow the Lamborghini motto by expecting the unexpected - the 2014 Lamborghini Veneno Roadster, open top variant of the 2013 Veneno, with its mighty V12 delivering 740 HP through its AWD driveline.this real-life Batmobile also produces tons of downforce and is just the type of car one would dream of taking to the Nordschleife for a truly hair-raising experience. The Veneno Roadster joins the Hypercars class.
